text: examined and testified as follows:
-  -  - EXAMINATION
Good morning, Mr. Labus.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Good morning.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: My name is Aaron Gorodetzer.  I'm an attorney and I represent Sherrilyn Hensley.  You understand that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And just for the record, your father, Gregory Labus, is sitting in the room with us today?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And per representation of your counsel, he is not going to be called as a witness in this matter?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: That's correct.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Mr. Labus, have you ever given a deposition before?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: No, I have not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  I'm gonna give you some basic instructions.  A deposition is a question-and-answer session.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes, I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And we have a court reporter here who's taking down our -- the questions and answers, so one of the things I'd ask you to do to keep the record clean is that you wait 'til I finish asking my question before you give your answers, so that way we keep the record clean.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes, I do.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: One of the things you've done well so far is you've given verbal responses.  So while I might understand a "uh-huh" or a head nod or a -- I'd ask that if the answer requires a verbal response, that you give a verbal response.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I'm sure if you don't, somebody will say, "Yes or no?" and get you to -- trigger you to do it. Also, I'd ask you not to anticipate where I'm going with the question.  You might think I'm going one way with the question, and I might totally change my line of thinking and ask a completely different question, which, if you anticipate, you might give the right answer to the wrong question.  You understand that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes, I understand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: If at any point -- if I ask a question, I'm gonna presume you understood it if you give an answer.  If you don't understand a -- a question or you need it repeated, please feel free to do that.  Do you --
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I understand.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: -- understand that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I'm sorry.  Yes, I understand that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You also understand that your testimony today is -- while we're in this informal setting, is under oath as if we were sitting inside a courtroom, correct?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And we're not here to ask you to guess about anything today, but if you can estimate something, just let me know that you're estimating.  Do you understand that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes, I -- I do understand that.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Are you under -- have you taken any drugs, alcohol, or any meditations that would prevent you from providing testimony today?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: No, I have not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you understand that we're here today regarding a March 3rd, 2017 automobile accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And it's my understanding that that accident happened at the intersection of Route 202 and Oakland Road in Chadds Ford Township, Pennsylvania?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And it would be a fair statement on -- on that date, you were operating a 2005 Chevy Malibu?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes, that's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the color of that vehicle was white?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Silver.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Silver.  And the owner of that vehicle would be your father, Gregory Labus?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: That is correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you were driving it permissively?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And on that date, the car was in good working order?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No mechanical issues that you were aware of?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Not to my knowledge.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And it's my understanding that the accident happened approximately 6:00 p.m. that night?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes, I believe so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you were traveling on your way to work at Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At that time, what was your job duties at Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I was a host.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how long had you been a host at Carrabba's prior to the accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Between one and one and a half years approximately. I'm estimating.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what were your hours at Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: My hours were usually from 2:00 or 3:00 in the afternoon to about 10:00 or 11:00 in the evening.  I'd like to also note that that was not always the case. Sometimes, you might come in around 5:00 or 6:00.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: On March 3rd, do you know what time you were supposed to be at Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't recall exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you still work at Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I do not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you stop working at Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Last summer.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So the summer of 2018?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And why did you stop working at Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I started working a different job.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what's your -- what was your new job?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Math tutoring.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who was your supervisor at the Carrabba's?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: At the time of the accident?
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: At the time of the accident.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I'm not sure how to answer this question.  There could be two answers.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, okay.  Let me try and flesh that out.  Who would have been in charge of your work schedule at Carrabba's at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Primarily, the assistant manager, and then, of course, the manager and owner also.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you -- are -- do you know if the manager slash owner is still the same today as it was back on the date of accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't know for sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, what was the name of the person?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I -- I don't recall her last name.  I do recall her first name.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was her first name?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Eleanor.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And this would have been the Carrabba's in the shopping center right on 202, before you get to Route 1?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So if I call it the Route 1, 202 Carrabba's, you'd know what I was talking about?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I would.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall if you were late for work on March 3rd, 2017?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't recall exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And on March 3rd, 2017, you were on your way to the Route 1, 202 Carabba's, traveling from your home -- your address at the time of 143 Lydia Lane in West Chester?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes, that's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you recall being involved in a motor vehicle accident on March 3rd, 2017?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And could you tell me -- describe to me, in your words, what happened.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I was coming from home, on my way to work.  And as I was approaching the light, I was trying to get through a yellow so that I could get to work.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How fast were you traveling?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't recall exactly.  I'd be estimating that it was somewhere around 60 miles per hour.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And the posted speed limit on Route 202 Southbound in that direction would be 45 miles an hour?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't know for sure, but I believe so.  I believe that's correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall:  Were you accelerating to try and get through the yellow light, or were you slowing down or keeping a steady speed?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't remember exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So as you were trying to get through the yellow light, what happens next?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: As I'm getting under the light, the other car was also going under the light, and we T-boned.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when you say "T-boned," what part of your car struck the other vehicle?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: My front end of my car struck the -- the passenger side of their car, the broad side.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did your airbags go off?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: My airbag did go off.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And prior to impact, do you recall striking your brakes?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I do believe I recall stepping on the brakes prior to impact.  There was a very short amount of time to do so, but I do remember trying to step on the brakes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How much time elapsed from the time you first saw the other vehicle 'til the time of impact?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would you say it was less than five seconds?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I can't say.  I don't remember.  I'm not sure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So after the impact, tell me what happened.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: After the impact, well, the -- the cars sort of spun to what would have been my right.  And didn't feel very well.  Felt -- you know, it wasn't fun. And then, I tried to get out of my car, and the car door needed some force getting open.  Some Samaritans came out of their cars and helped myself and, I believe, her out of her car.  Well, at least I know a Samaritan helped me get out of my car.  I guess I don't know about...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At the time of the accident, did you have a cell phone?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And were you using your cell phone at any time prior to impact?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: No, I was not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall what -- do you still have the same cell phone number?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what is that?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: And do you know who the carrier for that cell phone was at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who's your current carrier?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You don't know who your cell phone carrier is?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I -- I don't know, actually.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who pays for your cell phone?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: My father.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Would your father know who your cell phone provider was at the time of the accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I believe so.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: You see that?  You said he wasn't gonna be a witness.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: We can provide the cell phone provider.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Yeah.  I appreciate it. Yeah.  I would ask that just -- I will -- certainly, once I get the transcript, I -- I always hate when somebody tries to make me remember what I want after a deposition, so I will shoot you a follow-up letter.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Just send me an email, and I'll send you a --
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Perfect.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: -- information on it.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: It may have been part of my document request anyway, so whatever -- the cell phone records, texts, data, voice.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Well, usually, you would have to subpoena those.  If we don't have them, we don't provide them.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Okay.  Sometimes, it's -- they can just go back into their logs and print that stuff.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Yeah.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: If you want me to subpoena it, I'll subpoena it.  That's fine, but --
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Okay.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: And at the scene, tell me -- you got out of your car.  What happens next?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I was -- walked over to a sidewalk, and I sat down. Some of the Samaritans asked me how I was doing, if I was okay.  And then shortly, there were police and an ambulance on scene.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you have the names of any of these Samaritans?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I do not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did any of them leave you their contact information?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you say -- what did you tell the Samaritans?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I answered their questions about how I was feeling and if I was okay.  I said, "I'm okay, I think."
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you injured at all in this accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Not severely.  I had a slight concussion and some cuts from the broken glass, and I think that that was the extent of any injury.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you file a medical claim through any insurance company -- or any auto insurance?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I'm not aware of any claim.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Okay.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: So you're sitting on the sidewalk.  What happens next?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Eventually, a police officer comes up to me and wants to know if he can talk to me and ask me some questions.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Then what happens?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I answered the police officer's questions.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did you tell the police officer?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't remember exactly.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  After you get done talking to the police officer, what happens next?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I waited on the curb for a couple more minutes. And then, eventually, an ambulance was there, and some of the EMT people spoke to me.  And then, I was transported to a hospital.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did either of your parents arrive on the scene?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you took an ambulance to the hospital?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which hospital did you go to?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: At any point after the accident, prior to going to the hospital, did you contact your parents?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: Can you repeat the -- can you repeat the question, please.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yes, sir.  At any time prior to leaving the scene to go to the hospital, did you contact your parents?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't believe I did.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So other than the Samaritans and the police officer, did you speak to anybody else at the scene?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: The EMT people.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: EMT people.  Besides them, anybody else?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You didn't speak to my client at all at the scene?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: That is correct.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Have you ever spoken to my client?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I have not.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know if she was injured in this accident?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: I don't know for sure.  From what I've been told, she --
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Objection. I don't want you to answer anything that you've been told by Counsel --
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Yes.  Correct.  So --
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: -- as a result of the accident.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Correct.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: So just based on if you know at --
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Based on your personal knowledge.
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: -- at the scene of the accident.
speaker: MS. BARBETTA

text: Based on my personal knowledge, I do not know if she's injured -- or was injured.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  It would be a fair statement that you never called to see how Ms. Hensley was doing at any point?
speaker: MR. GORODETZER

text: No, because I haven't spoken to her.

text: No.
